node.title: Investors swindled out of millions by Sydney businesswoman a step closer to getting money back
node.alt: A woman smiles at the camera in a red jacket.
node.description: A court finds missing Sydney businesswoman Melissa Caddick broke the law by operating without the required financial services licence, ordering her company be wound up and permanent receivers appointed.
node.content:
["Dozens of investors who were swindled out of\u00a0millions of dollars by\u00a0missing Sydney businesswoman Melissa Caddick are a step closer to getting some of their money back.", "The 49-year-old, who posed as a financial adviser, went missing from her eastern suburbs home on November 12 last year,\u00a0leaving investors almost $24 million out of pocket.", "Her Dover Heights house was raided a day before her\u00a0disappearance\u00a0as part of an Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC) investigation into her finances and her boutique financial services company Maliver.\u00a0", "A court in July heard Ms Caddick misappropriated investors' money to buy real estate, holidays, and luxury goods over a period of eight years and sent them fictitious portfolio evaluations.\u00a0", "Two campers found a foot, which DNA testing showed belonged to Ms Caddick, on Bournda Beach near Tathra months after she went missing.", "", "
Melissa Caddick's home was raided by ASIC the day before she went missing.(ABC News)
", "ASIC has been pursuing court action to try to recover as much money as possible for her 72 clients, but the court has previously heard arguments her assets shouldn't' be liquidated until a Coroner has declared her dead.", "Justice Brigitte Markovic today found that Ms Caddick and her company both broke the law by operating without the required Australian financial services licence.", "She ordered the company be wound up and permanent receivers appointed to Ms Caddick's property.", "But she said owing to the unusual circumstances of the case, the receivers must approach the court for direction before taking possession of Ms Caddick's property or distributing any funds.", "Justice Markovic's judgment will be published on Wednesday to allow the parties 48 hours to consider redactions.", "", "
Melissa Caddick disappeared from\u00a0her Dover Heights home in November 2020.(Supplied)
", "Ms Caddick left her home for a run in November last year but without taking her mobile phone, wallet or keys and hasn't been seen since.", "The corporate watchdog dropped all charges against Ms Caddick more than five weeks after her foot washed up more than 400 metres from her home\u00a0to enable the\u00a0civil case to proceed.", "The mother was facing 38 charges, including falsely claiming she had a financial services licence and other fraud-related offences."]
